Subnav

One or more secondary navigation links. Goes well in a sidebar. Use .subnav-item-next to show a rightward arrow at smaller breakpoints.

  • Link text
  • Link text
  • Link text
  • Link text
  • Link text 
<ul class="subnav subnav-group">
    <li>
      <a class="subnav-item subnav-item-next" href="">
        Link text
      </a>
    </li>
    <li>
      <a class="subnav-item subnav-item-next" href="">
        Link text
      </a>
    </li>
    <li>
      <a class="subnav-item subnav-item-next" href="">
        Link text
      </a>
    </li>
    <li>
      <a class="subnav-item subnav-item-next" href="">
        Link text
      </a>
    </li>
    <li>
      <a class="subnav-item subnav-item-next" href="">
        Link text
      </a>
    </li>
</ul>

With Content

Subnavs are not limited to lists. Use .subnav-heading and .subnav-body to show summary content below an item.

Heading text

Content, content, content! 
<div class="subnav">
  <h3 class="subnav-heading">
    <a href="" class="subnav-item subnav-item-next">
      Heading text
    </a>
  </h3>
  <div class="subnav-body">
    Content, content, content!
  </div>
</div>

With Tertiary Nav

If .subnav-body is a list, it can accomodate .subnav-item elements presented as tertiary navigation.

Heading text

  • Link text
  • Link text
  • Link text
  • Link text
  • Link text 
<div class="subnav">
  <h3 class="subnav-heading">
    <a href="" class="subnav-item subnav-item-prev">
      Heading text
    </a>
  </h3>
  <ul class="subnav-body">
      <li>
        <a class="subnav-item" href="">
          Link text
        </a>
      </li>
      <li>
        <a class="subnav-item" href="">
          Link text
        </a>
      </li>
      <li>
        <a class="subnav-item" href="">
          Link text
        </a>
      </li>
      <li>
        <a class="subnav-item" href="">
          Link text
        </a>
      </li>
      <li>
        <a class="subnav-item" href="">
          Link text
        </a>
      </li>
  </ul>
</div>
